item.dc:creator: Rob Neyer
item.title: Baseball Blunders: Braves sign Babe
item.description: In an excerpt from his "Big Book of Baseball Blunders," Rob Neyer writes on the Braves' signing of Babe Ruth in 1935.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Preakness winner Bernardini not running in Belmont
item.description: Preakness winner Bernardini will not run in the Belmont Stakes, another blow to the final race of the Triple Crown series.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Broncos QB Plummer denies road-rage incident
item.description: Denver Broncos quarterback Jake Plummer on Wednesday said he did cut someone off while driving last month, but denied kicking and then backing up into another motorist's vehicle in a road-rage incident.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Source: Central Florida, O'Leary agree to new deal
item.description: Coach George O'Leary and Central Florida have agreed to a new 10-year contract, a source close to the coach told ESPN's Joe Schad on Wednesday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Roddick injures left foot, retires in World Team Cup
item.description: Andy Roddick injured his left foot Wednesday while playing Nicolas Massu of Chile at the World Team Cup and was forced to retire from the match in the first set.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Duke women's lacrosse to wear 'innocent' band
item.description: The Duke women's lacrosse team retains strong ties to the men's team currently embroiled in rape allegations.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Cards scratch Carpenter with swelling in back
item.description: St. Louis right-hander Chris Carpenter was scratched from his start against the San Francisco Giants on Wednesday with some swelling in the right side of his upper back.

item.dc:creator: External
item.title: USA's Reyna 'relieved', MRI on hamstring negative
item.description: Visit ESPN.com for the complete story.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Nuggets' Karl ready to mend fences with forward Martin
item.description: Nuggets coach George Karl said he believes the situation with forward Kenyon Martin can be resolved, though the two haven't spoken since Martin was suspended during Denver's first-round playoff series loss to the Clippers.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Texas 2005 championship ring for sale on eBay
item.description: Less than six months after Texas won its first undisputed football national championship in 36 years, a Longhorns championship ring is for sale on eBay, the online auction site.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Bobcats CEO/president, 1st employee hired, steps down
item.description: Ed Tapscott, the first employee hired when the NBA gave Charlotte the expansion Bobcats, stepped down Wednesday as president and CEO of the second-year team.

item.dc:creator: External
item.title: A's owners to try to bring MLS back to Bay Area
item.description: Visit ESPN.com for the complete story.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Jurassic start: Raptors claim No. 1 pick in NBA draft
item.description: New general manager Bryan Colangelo got a huge boost in his effort to rebuild the Toronto Raptors on Tuesday night, winning the NBA lottery and the No. 1 pick in next month's draft.

item.dc:creator: John Clayton
item.title: Owners plan three-month process to replace commish
item.description: NFL owners held an all-day meeting Tuesday in Denver to escalate both priorities, but no one can estimate how long each process will take.

item.dc:creator: John Clayton
item.title: Bush loses numbers game; back can't wear No. 5
item.description: The NFL Competition Committee rejected the request by Reggie Bush and other players to change their uniform numbering system for the 2006 season.
